This one is strange. She's an American citizen working out of Berlin? Has published instructions on how to move to Germany as a "freelancer". 30 yo? There's a story here - but I haven't been able to find it. Suspect she's queer.

She's effective tho. Apparently has managed to strip Breitbart of 70% of their revenue, and has doxed many others. Certain Breitbart must know a lot about her since she hurt them so badly.

That story about "people who live in glass houses"? Karma should visit this bitch.

Trying to find this "Legal Legion of Evil". Might send them money.

I have made it very, very clear that the Legal Legion and I will vigorously exercise our legal rights whenever an individual - whether she calls herself a reporter or not - or organization attempts to interfere with our various contractual relationships. And if anyone doubts that we've laid more than a few legal traps in preparation for those inevitable attempts, well, perhaps you should go and talk to Patreon about how much they are enjoying their current dance with the Legion.

And since we're on the subject, if you are a New York, Georgia, or California lawyer who is interested in collecting skulls and scalps by putting in some pro bono time with the LLoE, get in touch. I can assure you, no one is having more fun these days than the Legal Legion.


Would enjoy seeing her bogged down with legal debts for a decade. That would take her just past the point where reproduction becomes impossible - even with artificial assistance. She needs to die a bitter old spinster. Karma satisfied.

You don't take prisoners with censorship. Should always be a fight to the death....

topic.title: I trust the Tor people to do what they can to fix problems (but)
topic.body:
They sometimes come across as "stubborn little nerds" who deny their own eyes.

The Tor browser causes freezing and often glitches with Zeronet. Firefox does not. Not even a little bit.

I'm sure there's something I've missed along the way, but there are counters to that and I'm using them. Using any browser for a localhost server should be simple, simple, simple.

So these days I just leave the Tor browser running so Zeronet can use it's updated Tor proxy...but mostly post using Firefox....and always using the discipline of a full Zeronet URL. Helps to know where you are going......

If Zeronet was built correctly, nothing on the internet should see that browser. Any browser.

Just thought I'd pass this along. It will work until the Poindexters finish their arguments.

topic.title: ZeroTalk seems to be a wretched hive of crazy people...
topic.body:
https://www.reddit.com/r/zeronet/comments/es2kdq/zerotalk_seems_to_be_a_wretched_hive_of_crazy/

Thumb on nose salute to this guy:

"You can't replace the internet with something where 90% of the content is posted by moonbats and wingnuts. Before looking at it, I had hope that ZeroNet might replace the regular internet, but it's clear this network only exists for people who honestly believe that the regular internet and society in general is rotten to the core (rather than just tarnished by greed).

tl;dr: ZeroTalk is an online insane asylum, I'm going to run as far away from Zeronet as possible."

He needs to run to his mommy....

Males will be attracted to young females - that's not news. Or shouldn't be. They'd be defective if they weren't.

What's changed here are religions and cults. And few have the guts to stand up to such peer pressure. Particularly media fanned peer pressure. Accordingly, if your job was as useless and worthless as a royal - you would be scared too.  :)  Gravytrain upended.

If females can bleed - they can breed. Though too early breeding can do serious damage. That's why families once had a say and some restraint on the blind reproductive drive of males. They also demanded that their kin gain the ancient protections of marriage before sexual access was granted.

And that's the real problem here. Epstein was getting females on the cheap (or trying). Now that many of those females are well on their spinster path - they want revenge and money. It's that simple. Endless rationalizations will be aired to justify what they see as "mine"....and rest of us get to listen endlessly to this rubbish.

All was avoidable had Epstein simply become a citizen of a country where polygamy is legal - and just married them. Might not have worked for Andrew tho :) His "job" would have excluded such benefits :)

Things were so much simpler in Khan's time. If he wanted a woman - he just took her. Chances are he previously killed all her male relatives anyway....

https://www.thevintagenews.com/2018/06/09/genghis-khan/

I hate watching prominent males cower like Andrew. That alone is reason for the royals to get rid of him. He should have instead simply stated that he liked women and wanted more of them. Then let those heads explode.

And is some journo or activist had become a menace to him - he should have fucked their wife or daughter. Been that sneaky neighbor dog......

You're probably a privileged white male and don't see you would've done the same if you were him and was born into this fucked up world where you are considered little more than trash if you aren't born with a particular skin color.Fellow white people, we need to stop blaming other races for acts that we ourselves have driven them to commit.

That's bullshit. A thief is a thief. Clarity is seeing a thief as a thief and reacting to that. I'm not responsible for more thieves being born black. Bury them with the white thieves.

Our modern problem is too little violence. If you were a police officer pulling over a guy in the '50's - you knew he might be a survivor of Iwo Jima. They didn't take prisoners in that war. So you knew it might not be difficult for such individuals to add another notch and you would have handled them accordingly with respect and firmness. No police criminality.

Cops today know that the supply of such people has declined...so they are just more free to abuse. And they do.

That nigger took the bicycle because he knew he'd get away with it - not because of some systematic oppression he was dealing with. There's no need to overthink this. Kill this nigger and word will get around. They'll steal from someone else. Killing works. Plenty of evidence in the news ALL the time.
For all the SJW flies attracted to this dogshit: https://ibb.co/rQrc4pQ

> [styromaniac](#comment_1723_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): So... you think that retrospect will save your finances... [...]

Many states have castle laws. While killing someone is never routine and always has unforseen consequences (any lawyer will tell you that) - it's also true that ALL homeowners reliably are acquitted or never changed. Google it. It happens and it works. Even the lowest guy on the totem pole gets off under castle laws.

Now if you live in a state without castle laws, well....that's your rut. Enjoy it. Or change it. No need to live in a shithole country.

There was a case two years ago where a sheriffs deputy broke into a home at 2AM seeking to serve a warrant. He was shot and killed by the homeowner. Sheriff's department wanted this guy badly. He had a history, and had killed one of THEIRS.

Grand jury refused to charge him. It was dropped.

Submission to bullies and criminals is a drug. People who do that need rehab. The prospect of sudden deadly violence makes people civilized. It works and has worked for centuries.

> [draugrdeathlord](#comment_420_12BRJSQrTETJVZzt2jHdqPywv3SdugSywC): Corporate multinational tax evasion is the biggest theft foisted on us.

It's much worse than that. The Government just hands corporations our money while telling them "don't do that again". Same sort of limp dick response as when people allow others to take their shit. Corporate mutherfuckers who fail must just die. Should die. And if they caught not paying their taxes - we get to own them.

I don't doubt the sincerity of these "nice guys" who want everyone to get along or fix their mistakes. Just claim that it doesn't work. Nothing changes until someone or something dies. THEN things get fixed.

Wells Fargo - DEAD
Citi - DEAD
JPMorgan - Dead

None of these companies deserved to live. None of the fools who borrowed too much from them should have escaped bankruptcy.

We've managed to combine the worst of both capitalist and socialist thinking with no advantage to show for it. Government excess burn rate is now $1 tril/yr, the fed injected another half trillion in December just to prevent collapse - yet we keep doing the same things expecting better outcomes. Worse, the entire world copies these stupids. 

Easier to just fix it. Everyone goes through bankruptcy, lying promises get erased, and government lives within it's income. All would be better. Like ripping a bandage off instead of wringing your hands endlessly about it.

If we can't get that part right - the other efforts will fail.

We may also be in for a few surprises with our energy supplies - particularly petroleum energy (which is the most useful).

The problem has disappeared into our collective memory hole - but that doesn't mean we won't face it. No one is making any profit at current prices which means they will increase. Can we even function without cheap oil? Wonder - but have my own doubts.

Almost any new oil project except a very tiny sliver of outliers requires $100/bbl to break even. True even in the middle east.

When this miscalculation becomes obvious - there will be hell to pay.

draugrdeathlord â” 4 hours ago ^1 ^2
Reply
â‹®

There is no shortage of uranium and all its related isotopes. This energy scarcity is a manufactured crisis.

Not so sure. The easy stuff has been found. So while there may be "500 yrs or more" available - it won't be at an extraction price we can afford. It gets worse too. *IF* it becomes clear we really can't afford current CO2 emissions - what do we do then? Even turning entirely toward nuclear has problems. Like batteries, we've been working on that stuff for decades and none of the options are very good.

Doesn't help when people develop these religions and deliberately or unconsciously change the numbers. It's too easy to make big mistakes right now. Witness all these accounts detailing how poorly maintained all these weather stations are and how unreliable the historical data truly is. US has only 20ea calibrated weather stations. Probably much worse elsewhere. Yet that doesn't stop these people from wailing that the gods have turned against us.

Haven't investigated to determine if it's just more propaganda....but some claim windpower has a negative ROI. WTF....they were saying it was cheaper than gas. So who is lying here?

I really wish China and the US would quit trying to oneup and just trade. Win-win only. Both sides better off.

It's easy to enforce. Both sides pay only with expiring currency for purchases. If the selling party fails to use that currency within to years to purchase American or Chines goods - that currency becomes worthless.

We don't need endless negotiations from grand poobahs. We just need rules and enforcement.

Trump needs to get over this need of his to inject himself into evrything. Just fix the border and STFU. 

Bone weary of listening to the Washington clownposse babble.

1579391304_12BRJSQrTETJVZzt2jHdqPywv3Sdu.body:
There's no reason for it not to proceed peaceably. Only the Journos and Feds are ginning this. If everyone ignores them - nothing will happen. Citizen anger and personal weapons will be on display - but nothing else. Virginia's governor thanked the NRA this week for an earlier peaceful protest. These are everyday people, and I suspect there will be kids.

The issue is quite simple. Rightly or wrongly - these rights exist.  The only way to take them away is to amend the Constitution. It cannot be a duty of citizens to constantly re-litigate rights they already have. Winks and end runs around the Constitution simply aren't allowed - so Virginia IS breaking the law here. Attempting to use the raw naked force of the state to take rights away.

The Constitution is our fundamental agreement. Eliminate that - and literally anything goes. Outsiders really have no grasp of how the Bill of Rights has always exerted control over us. Our last civil war was fought simply over the inconsistencies between that document and slavery's reality. Likely 90% of the population didn't give a damn about slaves....but the mental gymnastics required to justify those practices just became too onerous.

Citizens DID give a damn about our own lies. Became weary of lying. Ultimately, our lies were purged by force. No one had any idea the purge would prove so costly. In today's equivalence, 6.2 million people were killed. WW2 was far less expensive.

I don't expect violence at this protest. DO expect many future Wacos if Virginia State police attempt to seize guns from homes. Violence will flare very rapidly should that happen. There was already an incident 2months ago in NY state. Our luck will not last. There is real danger if they attempt to collect those guns. Believe three gunowners have already been killed in such raids......

Very cringeworthy how many really believed that the Patriot Act would only be applied to bad guys. Not a peep from the public.....

We cannot rely on the founders to bail us out of everything. This was our own "damn fool test" - and we failed it.

> [aspidochelone](#comment_324_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsKABo1Z): Discipline and morale are things that hold on a society-wide basis.  If people believe that the cops are going to do the right thing, the protesters are going to do the right thing, the city/state/federal government is going to do the right thing, then it is easier for them to remain disciplined and do the right thing themselves.  But when they think the  government is conniving to put them in jail, the protesters are going to pull out the guns they've owned for twenty years and suddenly start shooting people, the cops are going to lie and set people up and collaborate with Nazis etc., then all the various players will be more willing to consider any such thing. [...]

I'm not certain that marches have the impact claimed. Letters, phone calls, and visits to state legislatures have more impact.

Remember this a while back when some state legislators were working through some liberalization bills, but the purists appeared in droves. As I told my own representative, "gun owners need to be more careful about frightening momma and less caught up in zealotries du jour". Those who have never been around guns often fear them. Something to be recognized, not validated by frightening behavior. If those fears are ever overcome (such as those antigun church goers in Texas)....positions will moderate. 

Nothing changes minds like quick action to save someone's kid.

That's what's needed here. Stepping back from the brink of threatening to invade homes to collect "bad" guns. Other concerns can be addressed if reason prevails.

> [quantumkitty](#comment_473_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEaQbNZu): Well, the copy cat effect is real and the science is there to back it up.Â People go on school shootings to become famous before they die, usually as a result of an inferiority complex. If you deprive school shooters of their fame, then the job becomes less glamorous.Â The more you share mass-shooter related content, the more you increase the chances of mass shootings happening. What you think about freedom of speech is irrelevant to the science.

Exactly and well phrased. Though it's ludicrous to lock people up for sharing videos.....

Makes you long for a terminal cancer patient who accepts "forbidden videos" - then takes out the judge convicting him for sharing. "Trade THIS video bitch".

Never let perfect be the enemy of good. There are endless discussions out there regarding the reliability of Tor. In the end, you either believe it's a honeypot - or you don't.

I worry more about their Poindexters not being up to government Poindexters. It's a very uneven match. And it's clear that government's who DO throw a lot of resources into malicious relays CAN generate mischief and some de anonymization.

Best way to counter that. Build a relay. Take a stand. Fight. There really is no room for spectators.....

There needs to be a simple rule: "A single on/off button must be provided which positively isolates appliances from the internet." "No prisoners" would work here.
